title: First vs Second Derivative Test Comparison
description: An interactive MicroSim comparing the First Derivative Test and Second Derivative Test methods for classifying critical points. Features step-through analysis with three coordinated graphs showing f(x), f'(x), and f''(x), plus special case handling when the second derivative test is inconclusive.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: calculus
derivatives
critical points
first derivative test
second derivative test
local extrema
optimization
learningObjective: Students will compare the First Derivative Test and Second Derivative Test methods for classifying critical points, understanding when each is most efficient and what each reveals about the function.

controls.name: stepButton
controls.description: Steps through the analysis: Find f', Apply 1st Test, Apply 2nd Test, Compare

controls.name: resetButton
controls.description: Resets the step-through to the beginning

controls.name: functionSelector
controls.description: Selects which function to analyze: x³-3x (standard), x⁴-2x² (quartic), x³ (inconclusive case)

controls.name: graphToggles
controls.description: Shows or hides individual graphs: f(x), f'(x), f''(x)
